page.description: Returns the corresponding value for the first condition that evaluates to true (.t.)
page.syntax: Value as A = CASE(condition_1 as L, value_1 as A, [condition_N as L, value_N as A])

argument.name: condition_1
argument.description: Logical. An expression that evaluates to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE).

argument.name: value_1
argument.description: The value returned if *[xb:condition_1]* evaluates to .t.

argument.name: condition_N
argument.description: Additional conditional statement that evaluates to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE). A maximum of 15 additional conditional expressions can be specified.

argument.name: value_N
argument.description: The corresponding values returned for the specified condition. A result is required for each condition specified.

return.name: Value
return.description: Returns the value that for the first condition that evaluates to .t..

discussion.p: CASE() returns the value (Value_1 ... Value_N) specified by the first expression (Condition_1...Condition_N) that evaluates to .T. (TRUE). A maximum 16 cases can be specified.
The CASE() function can be used to specify filter and order statements for searching and sorting records.

section.title: Example: Basic Example
section.example:
dim TEMP as N TEMP = 30
? case(TEMP < 32, "Cold", TEMP < 65, "Cool", TEMP < 80, "Warm", TEMP >= 80, "Really Hot") = "Cold"
TEMP = 75 ? case(TEMP < 32, "Cold", TEMP < 65, "Cool", TEMP < 80, "Warm", TEMP >= 80, "Really Hot") = "Warm"
TEMP = 90 ? case(TEMP < 32, "Cold", TEMP < 65, "Cool", TEMP < 80, "Warm", TEMP >= 80, "Really Hot") = "Really Hot"

section.title: Example: Filter Records
section.description: If you wanted to filter records for a limited number of specific values, you use this type of expression, which will examine the firstname field and select records containing the values "John", "Peter", and "Sally".

section.title: Example: Sorting Records
section.description: You can create an explicit order for records using the CASE() function. For example:
section.example: case(containsi("Jan Feb Mar",month), 1, containsi("Apr May Jun",month), 2, containsi("Jul Aug Sep",month), 3, containsi("Oct Nov Dec",month), 4)
